definition: immediately before the last one
a person who is in charge of or works in a library
a vegetable like a long onion with many layers of wide leaves that are white at the bottom and green at the top. Leeks are eaten cooked. The leek is a national symbol of Wales.
a person who makes or repairs things made of gold
sweet food eaten at the end of a meal
with a meaning that is hidden or not easily understood
with difficult clues that involve a kind of word puzzle
a person who studies or writes about economics
a tropical plant with many branches and long roots that you can eat
the roots of this plant, which can be boiled, fried, roasted or made into flour
a doctor who studies and treats diseases of the nerves
a tropical plant with many branches and long roots that you can eat
the roots of this plant, which can be boiled, fried, roasted or made into flour
a tropical fruit with smooth yellow or red skin, that is soft and orange inside with a large seed
a small sea creature with a round shell that is covered with spikes
a small Chinese fruit with thick, rough red skin and that is white inside with a large seed
to put your arms around somebody and hold them tightly, especially to show that you like or love them
to put your arms around something and hold it close to your body
to keep close to something for a distance
to fit tightly around something, especially a person’s body
an act of putting your arms around somebody as a sign of love or friendship
the act of accepting an idea, a proposal, a set of beliefs, etc, especially when it is done with enthusiasm
the machines and electronic parts in a computer or other electronic system
tools and equipment that are used in the house and garden
the equipment, machines and vehicles used to do something
the long deep sound made by a cow
a doctor who studies the endocrine system and hormones
the scientific study of human sexual behaviour
a scientist who studies human sexual behaviour
a person from New Zealand
a New Zealand bird with a long beak, short wings and no tail, that cannot fly
a small fruit with thin brown skin covered with small hairs, that is soft and green inside with black seeds
an area of land that is covered with trees
an object for holding a candle
to cook meat or fish under direct heat or over heat on metal bars
to become or make somebody become very hot
a thick slice of good quality beef
a thick slice of any type of meat
beef that is not of the best quality, often sold in small pieces and used in pies, stews, etc.
a large thick piece of fish

a small green fruit that grows on a bush with thorns. Gooseberries have a bitter sharp taste and are usually cooked to make jam, pies, etc. Children are sometimes told that babies come from ‘under the gooseberry bush’.
to be a third person with two people who have a romantic relationship and want to be alone together
the fact of words containing sounds similar to the noises they describe, for example hiss; the use of words like this in a piece of writing
making you feel embarrassed
difficult to deal with
not convenient
difficult or dangerous because of its shape or design
not moving in an easy way; not comfortable
behaving in a confused way, often making careless mistakes
shy or uncomfortable when dealing with people and often saying or doing the wrong thing
not seeming to be based on a reason, system or plan and sometimes seeming unfair
using power without limits and without considering other people
a person with the power or influence to make judgements and decide what will be done or accepted
a doctor who studies and treats the diseases of old people
the system and practices of Freemasons
the friendship that exists between people who have the same profession or interests
an area in the ground or a shallow container, filled with sand for children to play in
a test area on a computer system, where you can run software without affecting the hardware or other software
a video game style that allows players to explore the game freely, make changes to the way it looks, or establish their own rules
a small bed with high sides for a baby or young child
a long open box that horses and cows can eat from
a model of the scene of Jesus Christ’s birth, placed in churches and homes at Christmas
a set of notes to help you remember important information, especially one taken secretly into an exam room
a card game in which players score points by collecting different combinations of cards. The score is kept by putting small pegs in holes in a board.
the house, flat, etc. where somebody lives
